title: Derby’s Take: As FOMC Meeting Nears, Two Fed Governors Issue Hawkish Warnings
sub_head: Christopher Waller and Randal Quarles say the central bank’s timing for an interest rate rise could be moved forward
body:
Federal Reserve governors are leading the way when it comes to hawkish talk at the central bank about what may be needed to bring high levels of inflation back under control.
Over recent weeks, two Fed governors have said that if inflation doesn’t start moderating relatively soon, they believe that could move forward the central bank’s timing for an interest rate rise.
